title: Pathological Report & Prescription Simplifier – Mobile App

requirements.text: Design a mobile-first UI with a clean, medical-themed visual identity. Use a calming color palette (e.g., soft greens and whites), clear sans-serif typography, and card-based layouts optimized for small screens. Display a company logo prominently on the home/splash screen and in the top navigation bar consistently across all pages.

quotes: kindly try to converted into a mobile base application with the company logo

acceptanceCriteria: App layout is fully responsive and usable on mobile screen widths (320px–480px).
Company logo appears on the splash/home screen and in the app header.
Color palette and typography are consistent across all screens.
All interactive elements (buttons, inputs) are touch-friendly with appropriate tap target sizes.

requirements.text: Provide an input screen where users can type or paste the text of a pathological lab report and/or a general doctor's prescription into separate labeled text areas. Include a clear 'Convert' or 'Simplify' action button.

quotes: Take any pathological report and general doctor prescription

acceptanceCriteria: Two distinct labeled text input areas exist: one for pathological reports, one for doctor prescriptions.
At least one of the two fields must have content before the Convert action can be triggered.
A clearly labeled 'Simplify Report' button triggers the conversion flow.
Input fields scroll independently if content is long.

requirements.text: Store submitted reports and their simplified summaries in the backend. Each record should capture: a unique ID, submission timestamp, the original report text, the original prescription text, and the generated simplified summary text.

quotes: pathological report conversion into a standard summary and it should be standardized

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor exposes a function to save a new report record with all required fields.
Backend actor exposes a function to retrieve all saved records.
Backend actor exposes a function to retrieve a single record by its unique ID.
Records persist across canister upgrades.

requirements.text: Implement a report simplification engine in the backend that processes the raw pathological report and prescription text and produces a standardized plain-language summary. The summary must: (a) list key findings in bullet points, (b) translate medical jargon into simple everyday words (e.g., 'hypertension' → 'high blood pressure'), (c) list medications with their purpose and basic dosage instruction in plain terms, and (d) include a 'What to do next' section with actionable steps.

quotes: pathological report conversion into a standard summary and it should be standardized
integrate it in a simple language so any non english speaking person can understand that

acceptanceCriteria: The simplification function accepts report text and prescription text as inputs and returns a structured summary.
Output summary contains clearly separated sections: Key Findings, Medications, and What To Do Next.
Medical terms present in a predefined glossary are replaced with plain-language equivalents in the output.
The summary avoids unexplained abbreviations and Latin medical terms.

requirements.text: Display the generated simplified summary on a dedicated results screen. The summary must be presented in clearly labeled sections (Key Findings, Medications, What To Do Next) with large, readable text. Include a language selector allowing the user to choose their preferred display language from at least: English, Hindi, Spanish, French, Arabic, and Bengali. The section headings and instructional UI text must render in the selected language.

quotes: integrate it in a simple language so any non english speaking person can understand that

acceptanceCriteria: Results screen shows the summary divided into at least three labeled sections.
A language selector dropdown/menu is visible on the results screen.
Selecting a language updates the UI labels and section headings to the chosen language.
Summary body text font size is at least 16px for readability.
A 'Back' button allows the user to return to the input screen.

requirements.text: Provide a history screen that lists all previously processed reports in reverse-chronological order. Each list item should show the submission date/time and a short excerpt of the simplified summary. Tapping a history item opens the full simplified summary for that record.

quotes: pathological report conversion into a standard summary and it should be standardized

acceptanceCriteria: History screen is accessible from the main navigation.
Each history entry displays the timestamp and a summary excerpt (first 100 characters).
Tapping an entry navigates to the full results view for that record.
History list is ordered newest-first.
If no records exist, a friendly empty-state message is displayed.

constraints: The app must be mobile-first; all screens must be fully usable on screens 320px–480px wide.
All user-facing text must be in English by default, with multilingual UI labels for the results screen.
No external AI or LLM APIs may be used; the simplification logic must be implemented within the Motoko backend using a rule-based/glossary approach.
All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo).
nonGoals: Integration with hospital or laboratory systems via external APIs.
Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for scanning physical documents or images of reports.
User authentication or login (no Internet Identity in this version).
Real-time collaborative or shared report viewing.
Diagnosis or medical advice — the app only simplifies and summarizes existing reports.

required: MediClear company logo: a clean medical cross icon combined with a speech bubble, rendered in soft green and white on a transparent background (logo.dim_256x256.png)
Mobile app splash screen background: abstract soft gradient with subtle medical-themed line art (cells, heartbeat line) in muted green and off-white tones (splash-bg.dim_1080x1920.png)
